children.value: We study the convergence of AB4 using the

children.html: u′=sin⁡[(u+t)2]u'=\sin[(u+t)^2]u′=sin[(u+t)2]
0≤t≤40\le t \le 40≤t≤4
u(0)=−1u(0)=-1u(0)=−1

children.value: is called to give an accurate reference solution.
Now we perform a convergence study of the AB4 code.

n = @. [round(Int, 4 * 10^k) for k in 0:0.5:3]
err = []
for n in n
    t, u = FNC.ab4(ivp, n)
    push!(err, norm(u_ref.(t) - u, Inf))
end
@pt :header=["n", "inf-norm error"] [n err]

text/html.content:
n inf-norm error
4 0.50044
13 1.39129
40 0.00627809
126 9.94942e-5
400 1.09598e-6
1265 1.12766e-8
4000 1.13736e-10

children.html: O(h4)O(h^4)O(h4)

children.value: , so a log-log scale is appropriate for the errors.

using Plots
plot(n, err, m=3, 
    label="AB4",  legend=:bottomleft,
    xaxis=(:log10, L"n"),  yaxis=(:log10, "inf-norm error"),
    title="Convergence of AB4")

plot!(n, 0.1 * err[end] * (n / n[end]) .^ (-4), l=:dash, label=L"O(n^{-4})")
